data.title: Martha and Snoop's friendship is Olympic gold in primetime: 'Two stars - me and Martha'
data.meta_description: The former TV cohosts are back together again on NBC during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Here's what they've been up to during weekend two in Paris.
data.text:
Rapper Snoop Dogg continued his Summer Games exploits this weekend in the 2024 Paris Olympics. So far he's been one of Team USA's top cheerleaders in gymnastics and went swimming with Olympic legend Michael Phelps.

On Saturday, he attended equestrian dressage events - in full gear - with longtime TV cohost and friend Martha Stewart in Versailles. The two later were featured in primetime at Le Cinq, a three-Michelin-star restaurant in Paris.

The duo hosted three seasons of the variety show "Martha & Snoop's Potluck Dinner Party" on VH1 from 2016 to 2020. They tried canape, escargot, and more from La Cinq in NBC's clip during primetime.

Snoop Dogg and Martha Stewart take in dressage

The two had front-row seats for the equestrian team dressage event in Versailles. Germany took gold ahead of Denmark and Great Britain in the finals.

Snoop and Martha were witnesses to Olympic history. German team dressage competitor Isabell Werth became the first athlete to win a medal at seven different Olympic Games. She's won gold in either team or individual dressage in the 1992, 1996, 2000, 2008, 2016, 2020, and 2024 Summer Games.

What's next for Snoop Dogg on NBC?

Saturday isn't the last time viewers will see Snoop and Martha in primetime. NBC host Mike Tirico teased more from the two friends for Sunday night in prime time.

"The dynamic duo was in Versailles in full equestrian attire," Tirico said on the broadcast. "We'll show you how this went tomorrow."

Paris Olympics 2024: How to watch the Summer Games across TV and streaming

Every event at the 2024 Paris Olympics will be aired live across NBC, USA Network, E!, CNBC, GOLF Channel, and there will be a Spanish broadcast on Universo and Telemundo. All events will be available to stream live on Peacock and NBCOlympics.com.

Date: July 24-Aug. 11

TV: Games broadcast across NBC, USA Network, E!, Telemundo, Universo, CNBC and Golf Channel

Streaming: Peacock, nbcolympics.com, fuboTV

HOW TO WATCH: Catch the Paris Olympics with a Peacock subscription
